body.name: ASUS - MOTHERBOARDS TPM SPI Module System Components MOTHERBOARDS
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Wednesday, February 21 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
features: Additional Information: Interface: SPI Features: TPM IC: Nuvoton NPCT750 TPM Version: TPM 2.0 Pin Dimension: 14-1pin System Requirements: Windows® 10, UEFI OS
body.description: Improve your Computer's Security The TPM-SPI card securely store keys, digital certificates, passwords, and data. It helps enhance the network security, protects digital identities, and ensures platform integrity. Designed with 14-1 pin and SPI interface Chip: Nuvoton NPCT750, compliant with TCG specification Family "2.0" Rev1.38 Common Criteria EAL4+ Certified FIPS 140-2 Certified CE and RoHS Compliance . Manufacturer: ASUS Computer International. Manufacturer Part Number: TPM-SPI. Brand Name: Asus. Product Model: TPM-SPI. Product Name: TPM-SPI Trusted Platform Module (TPM). Packaged Quantity: 1. Product Type: Trusted Platform Module (TPM). [Physical Characteristics] Color: Black. Width: 0.6". Depth: 0.5". [Miscellaneous] Additional Information: Interface: SPI Features: TPM IC: Nuvoton NPCT750 TPM Version: TPM 2.0 Pin Dimension: 14-1pin System Requirements: Windows® 10, UEFI OS . Environmentally Friendly: Yes. Environmental Certification: RoHS.

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.5 4.5 out of 5 stars 663 ratings 4.5 out of 5 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Unlike the fTPM, the discrete TPM is unlikely to crash or cause weird stuttering...From a security standpoint, this module is also preferable as it has a separate coprocessor solely for encryption keys.Make sure this is the correct one for your board. Many different pinouts exist, even from the same vendors.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars useful for win 11
reviews.reviewText: no trouble installing and configuring for windows 11. HAVE NOT SPENT A LOT OF TIME WITH TPM CONFIGURATION YET BUT HAVEN'T NOTICED ANY ILL EFFECTS OF HAVING IT ON THE MB.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works with Asus TUF Gaming B550m-Plus
reviews.reviewText: So physically small, it's hard to install, but after gingerly nudging it onto the pin headers it was detected right away on the bios.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Replaced Ryzen 5800x fTPM with a dedicated one.
reviews.reviewText: Installed onto a Asus Prime Pro x570 and changed bios setting to use the installed TPM as the Ryzen fTPM seems to be causing stuttering. Works as expected and no longer having stutters.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works as expected
reviews.reviewText: This is the 2nd discrete TPM I've purchased and unlike the 1st one I bought locally in South Africa, this one works perfectly on my Asus ROG Strix X570 motherboard. It's extremely unfortunate that discrete TPM devices have different pin outs instead of being standardized as that only leads to confusion to the end user. Hopefully in the future every manufacturer sticks to the same connector pin out in the future.Nonetheless, I installed this onto my motherboard extremely easily, went into the UEFI settings and changed my TPM from the AMD Firmware option to Discrete instead and then rebooted. Everything worked just as expected and the TPM is immediately picked up in Windows 11 without any issue.The TPM was packaged well enough for such a tiny device and despite travelling halfway around the planet, arrived with no damage and perfectly intact.Overall, I wish manufacturers just included these in the box by default, but that aside this worked perfectly, so 5 stars from me.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A bit hard to install, but seems to work fine in Windows 10 on X570 STRIX motherboard
reviews.reviewText: The piece is very small, and the manual for the ASUS motherboard (X570 STRIX in my case) shows a diagram where it needs to be plugged in to some pin headers, just adjacent to the CPU and graphics card slot.The only issue is that the spot is going to be below the graphics card (in my case a 2080ti).So needing to pull the graphics card out, and then finding a way to press this small board down on a header that is somewhat underneath the CPU cooler.... you can't get your hand/fingers in there.My solution seemed to work well - get some poster tack / blue tack, and a pencil with a squared off eraser (or a dowel or a pen with a flat end). Apply the tack to the squared of end of the pencil, then stick the top side to that tack. This puts the tiny board on the end of a stick held on by the tack. Now you can carefully maneuver it down and over the pin header under the CPU cooler. Press it down carefully (be sure to align the keyed pin correctly), and it slides on easily enough. Twist the pencil and the blue tack off and bobs your uncle.Reinstall graphic card, put the rest of the tower back together, boot up and enter the BIOS/UEFI and go to the security/advanced section to make sure the TPM is enabled and selected (and not the CPU based software TPM). Booting into Windows and checking by running TMP.msc to verify its up and found.. and it was. Good to go.Now the only thing standing between going to Windows 11 is deciding if I want to enable UEFI in place of BIOS, with the recovery boot nightmare that can cause... so for now I'm staying BIOS and Windows 10.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fit like a glove and it works!
reviews.reviewText: Upgraded my 8 year old pc. Replaced the mother board and decided to add a TPM module for encryption security etc. By luck I decided to research TPMs and found they are not all made equal. So went to manufacturer website found right one then checked on Amazon and found this item. Bought it and arrived on time. I installed it in less than 10minutes. Quality is good. I'm now encrypted and secured. If you gonna buy a tpm module check manufacturer website recommendation for your motherboard first. Don't forget to enable tpm in the bios and if your on windows tpm.msc bitlocker. etc

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars YOU have to make sure it's the right one! Don't trust ASUS Reps!
reviews.reviewText: I had purchased 2 of these in Nov 2021 for me and my wife - Prime Z390-A motherboards. ASUS Rep said it would work... Can't trust them. Most of them SEEM to have a proper picture; so you have to either look at your MB's pin configuration and compare it to the images and type of TPM!!! This motherboard has a empty pin at pin 10. Therefore the one I need should have a 'block' at Pin 10. This one has a block at Pin 1 or pin 2, not sure. So this one will not fit a Prime Z390-A MB.

reviews.reviewTitle: Asus TPM SPI module component worked perfectly an an Asus Prime Z590-V motherboard.
reviews.reviewText: Bought this TPM module for an Asus Prime Z590-V motherboard for use with Windows 11. Found iteasy to install and have had no problems with the module

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfetto per Asus serie Z590 e win 11
reviews.reviewText: Perfetto per acere win11 silla9 scheda Asus rog strix z590; tuttavia segnalo che tale scheda ha già la funzione TPM 2.0 integrata nel firmware del BIOS.
Schneller Versand,Ware genau wie beschrieben,alles bestens.

reviews.reviewTitle: ASUS Prime Z790P-CSMで認識・使用OK、大型グラボとも物理的干渉なし！
reviews.reviewText: 本品はASUS Prime Z790P-CSMのBIOSではディスクリートTPMモジュールとして認識したためBIOSの設定で有効化でき、Windows11のデバイスマネージャーからもディスクリートTPMとして正しく認識し、問題なく使用できました。本品はマザーボード上のTPMヘッダピンと接続するピンジャックと、本品の基板が90度になっておりマザーボード上のTPMヘッダピンに装着すると基板部分は水平に装着されます。そのため私の使用している大型のグラフィックカード（ASUS TUF-RTX3080TI-12G-GAMING）と本品の高さは全く干渉せず問題なく本品とグラフィックカードは併用できております。価格も安価で動作も問題なく、大型のグラフィックカードども物理的形状の干渉もないため、非常にありがたい製品だと思います。
